meanings.sent1: She always has a gripy attitude when things don't go her way.
meanings.sent2: The gripy customer kept complaining about the service at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat seemed gripy when it didn't get its favorite treat.
meanings.sent4: The gripy sound of the squeaky door echoed through the house.
meanings.sent5: The gripy tone in his voice made it clear he was not happy.

meanings.definition: Having a tendency to complain or criticize
meanings.sent1: His gripy nature often led to conflicts with his friends.
meanings.sent2: The teacher grew tired of the gripy student's constant complaints.
meanings.sent3: The gripy old man grumbled about the weather every day.
meanings.sent4: Her gripy comments were like nails on a chalkboard to him.
meanings.sent5: The gripy coworker made the office atmosphere tense and unpleasant.

meanings.sent1: The gripy sound of the alarm clock woke her up abruptly.
meanings.sent2: The gripy noise of the construction work outside was driving him crazy.
meanings.sent3: The gripy fly buzzing around the room was incredibly annoying.
meanings.sent4: The gripy smell of burnt popcorn lingered in the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The gripy sensation of sand in her shoes made her uncomfortable.
